newsitem.title: USA: IMCO Recycling arranges $125 million credit.
newsitem.headline: IMCO Recycling arranges $125 million credit.

text.p: IMCO Recycling Inc said on Wednesday it has arranged $125 million in senior secured credit facilities, and used some of the funds to complete its purchase of IMSAMET.
The credit facilities include a $105 million term loan and a $20 million revolving credit agreement.

IMCO said it used some term loan funds to complete its previously announced purchase of IMSAMET for $58 million in cash. IMSAMET, which owns or co-owns aluminum recycling plants in Arizona, Idaho and Utah, had been a wholly owned subsidiary of EnviroSource Inc.
Acquiring the IMSAMET plants boosts IMCO's effective annual processing capacity to 2.2 billion pounds, 36 percent higher than it was last year.

IMCO also said it completed its previously announced plan to buy Rock Creek Aluminum Inc for $9.5 million in new IMCO shares. These transactions leave IMCO with outstanding total debt of $117.4 million, the company said.
